title: aliasing
content:
Aliasing occurs when two variables refer to the same object in memory. Modifying the object through one alias affects the other. For example:
```python
x = [1, 2, 3]
y = x
y[0] = 9
print(x)  # Output: [9, 2, 3]
```
Understanding aliasing is critical for debugging side effects in mutable objects like lists.
